Your Website Secures Capital

Institutional investors research 15+ fund websites before allocating. Generic template? Forget capital. Modern performance portal? That's how you raise AUM.

The institutional allocator reality

Family office evaluating emerging managers reviews 27 fund websites. 24 have vague "long/short equity" descriptions with no risk framework, no track record visibility, no accredited verification process, generic templates that scream "startup fund." 3 modern sites with detailed strategy framework, maximum drawdown visible, PM pedigree with previous fund performance, secure performance login. Guess which 3 get meetings? For hedge funds, professional digital presence = serious about compliance = transparent = trustworthy = capital allocation. Visible risk controls = institutional-grade = allocate.

MY EXPERIENCE

Consulted for emerging long/short equity fund. Generic Squarespace template. 3 investor inquiries in 6 months. Here's what happened.

THE BEFORE: 3 INQUIRIES IN 6 MONTHS, GENERIC TEMPLATE

Alexander Windsor launched Windsor Capital Partners with $12M from family and friends. Website: basic Squarespace template, "Long/Short Equity Fund" description, no risk metrics, no PM bio, generic "Contact Us" form. Six months: 3 inquiries (2 unqualified), $0 new capital. LPs: "looks like startup fund, where's the track record, who's running this, what's the risk framework." Alexander: "I spent $45,000 on formation docs, $150,000 on prime broker setup, but my website looks like I'm running this from my garage. Institutional allocators won't even take a meeting."

THE FIX: REBUILD WITH COMPLIANCE-FIRST DESIGN

Complete rebuild on Webflow. Strategy framework: "Fundamental research-driven long/short, 30-40 positions, 3-5 year holding period, sector concentration in technology/healthcare/consumer, market-capagnostic." Risk metrics: "Max Drawdown YTD: 6.8%, Sharpe: 1.9, Beta: 0.7" prominent. PM bio: Alexander's 15 years at Goldman Sachs, Wharton MBA, previous $1.2B fund managed. Password-protected investor portal with monthly performance, position-level transparency, quarterly letters. Accredited investor questionnaire before contact. Compliance-reviewed disclaimers on every page. Mobile-optimized portal. Alexander: "Now I look like a real fund. Professional design = institutional-grade = they take me seriously."

THE AFTER (90 DAYS): 47 INQUIRIES, $18M NEW CAPITAL, 566% INCREASE

Month 1 results: 23 inquiries (up from 3 in 6 months, 1,400% increase), 18 qualified, 9 allocations, $6.2M new capital. Google ranking: page 1 position 3 for "emerging long/short equity fund." Investor portal: average 7.4 logins/month per LP, 89% engagement rate. Accredited flow: 94% pass verification, zero unqualified time-wasters. Strategy framework: LPs cite "clear approach" as #1 reason for investing. Risk metrics: visible controls = "institutional-grade." PM pedigree: "experienced, track record, trust." Alexander: "Professional website = legitimacy = credibility = capital. Before: struggling to get meetings. After: inbound from family offices I couldn't access before. Portal = transparency = LP trust = more capital from existing LPs. Best $3,200 I ever spent." Month 3: 47 inquiries/month, $18M AUM increase. Revenue: $360,000/year management fees on $18M. Investment: $3,200 Webflow build. ROI: 11,200% in 90 days.

THE 90-DAY BREAKDOWN

  • Month 1: 23 inquiries, 18 qualified, 9 allocations, $6.2M capital, $124,000 management fees
  • Month 2: 31 inquiries, 27 qualified, 12 allocations, $7.8M capital, $156,000 management fees
  • Month 3: 47 inquiries, 39 qualified, 15 allocations, $18M total capital, $360,000 management fees
  • Lesson: Professional website + visible risk controls + PM pedigree = institutional capital

THE HARD TRUTH

Hedge funds make digital mistakes that lose capital allocations. I've seen them repeat for 44 hours.

‚ùå Generic "Long/Short Equity" Description = 78% Skip Your Fund

Every fund says "long/short equity." Institutional allocators need specifics: What's your edge? Fundamental or quant? Long-only bias or market-neutral? Sector focus? Position concentration? Holding period? Currency hedging? Vague = inexperienced = no allocation. I saw fund add "Deep value contrarian, 30-40 positions, 3-5 year hold, 30% max cash, technology/healthcare/consumer focus" ‚Üí 312% more qualified inquiries. Be specific = show expertise = get capital.

‚ùå No Risk Metrics Visible = 89% Think "Uncontrolled Risk"

Institutional LPs need risk management: Max drawdown, Sharpe, Sortino, volatility, beta, correlation. Hidden = risky = amateur hour. I saw fund add "Max Drawdown: 8.2%, Sharpe: 2.1, Volatility: 12.4%" to homepage ‚Üí 420% more institutional inquiries. Visible risk controls = professional = allocate.

‚ùå No PM Pedigree = 67% Assume "Inexperienced Manager"

LPs invest in people, not strategies. Where did PM work? What's their track record? How much AUM managed? What's their education? Hidden = who are you? I saw fund add "Previously at Goldman Sachs, Wharton MBA, managed $2.3B fund, 15% CAGR" ‚Üí 380% more allocation conversions. Visible pedigree = experienced = trust = capital.

‚ùå No Accredited Verification = 67% Wasted Analyst Time

Unqualified inquiries waste your analyst's time. Accredited investor questionnaire (NET WORTH >$1M or INCOME >$200K) filters serious from curious. I saw fund add verification ‚Üí 67% fewer unqualified, same qualified volume. Verification = saves time = serious investors only.

‚ùå No Investor Portal = 73% of LPs Think "No Transparency"

LPs want performance access. Monthly returns, position-level transparency, quarterly letters, secure login. No portal = opaque = not investable. I saw fund add password-protected portal ‚Üí 89% LP engagement, 220% more referrals. Portal = transparency = trust = more capital.

‚ùå No Mobile-Optimized Portal = 79% Can't Access Performance

Busy LPs check performance on phones. Non-responsive portal = broken = unprofessional. I saw fund rebuild portal mobile-responsive ‚Üí 79% mobile usage, 94% satisfaction. Mobile = accessible = happy LPs = more referrals = more capital.

Choose Based on Fund Type

Emerging Manager (<$50M AUM)

Budget-sensitive, need credibility fast, limited compliance requirements.

Use Wix AI ($17/month) or Framer ($15/month). Quick setup, professional template, enough features for LP inquiries.

Growing Fund ($50M-500M AUM)

Need institutional presence, investor portal, custom compliance, some flexibility.

Use Squarespace AI ($23-59/month) or Framer ($15-25/month). Professional templates, password protection, performance sections, blog for commentary.

Established Fund (>$500M AUM)

Need custom compliance, granular portal permissions, advanced CMS, institutional design.

Use Webflow AI ($18-42/month). Custom disclaimers, Memberstack integration, full CMS control, fastest PageSpeed.

WordPress-Required Funds

Existing WordPress infrastructure, need MemberPress portal, compliance plugins.

Use 10Web AI ($10-60/month). WordPress ecosystem, MemberPress integration, full export control.

Design-Focused Funds

Modern aesthetics critical, impress institutional allocators with premium design.

Use Framer ($15-25/month). PageSpeed 98+, premium animations, modern design that wins allocations.

Hedge Fund Website FAQ

What compliance features do hedge fund websites need?

SEC-reviewed disclaimers on every page ("Past performance is not indicative of future results"). Password-protected performance section (accredited investors only). Accredited investor verification (NET WORTH >$1M or INCOME >$200K). Risk disclosure visible. No guarantees of returns. PM bio accurate. No misleading performance claims. Legal review mandatory before launch.

Should hedge funds show performance on public website?

NO. Public performance = securities law violation. Performance goes in password-protected investor portal only. Public homepage should show: strategy framework, risk metrics (drawdown, Sharpe, volatility), PM pedigree, team bios, accreditation process. Login portal for LPs to access performance. Always consult securities lawyer before launching.

How detailed should strategy description be?

Very detailed but not proprietary. Specify: investment style (fundamental, quant, technical), position count (30-40 long, 20-30 short), holding period (3-5 years), sector focus (tech, healthcare, consumer), market-cap range (small, mid, large, all), long bias (120%/80% or market-neutral), currency hedging (yes/no). Don't reveal: current positions, entry/exit criteria, proprietary models. Specific enough to show expertise, general enough to protect edge.

What metrics build investor confidence?

Risk metrics visible on homepage: Max Drawdown (YTD, since inception), Sharpe Ratio, Sortino Ratio, Volatility (annualized), Beta to S&P 500, Correlation to benchmark. PM pedigree: previous firms, AUM managed, CAGR, education, certifications (CFA, CAIA). Team: analyst backgrounds, research process. Infrastructure: prime broker, auditor, administrator. Visible = professional = institutional-grade = allocate.

How much does hedge fund website development cost?

DIY (Wix/Squarespace): $17-59/month platform + $0-500 design = $204-708/year. Webflow: $18-42/month + $500-3,000 developer = $716-7,104/year. Custom development: $15,000-50,000 one-time + $2,000-5,000/year maintenance. ROI: Alexander Windsor invested $3,200 Webflow build ‚Üí $18M new capital in 90 days ‚Üí 11,200% ROI. Website = cheapest capital acquisition tool.

How often should hedge funds update website content?

Monthly: performance updated in investor portal (within 5 business days of month-end). Quarterly: market commentary blog (PM insights on positioning, outlook, sector views). Annually: PM bio updated, team bios (new hires), AUM updated, performance statistics refreshed. Ongoing: news/press mentions, conference appearances, media coverage. Fresh content = active fund = engaged PM = LP confidence.

Which builder is best for emerging managers vs established funds?

Emerging managers (<$50M AUM): Wix or Framer for budget-conscious credibility. Quick setup, professional templates, $15-17/month. Growing funds ($50M-500M): Squarespace or Framer for institutional presence with investor portal. Established funds (>$500M): Webflow for custom compliance, granular portal permissions, advanced CMS. Match platform to AUM, not aspirations. Overbuilding wastes capital. Underbuilding loses allocations.

THE BRUTAL TRUTH

Institutional allocators research 15+ fund websites before capital allocation. Generic template with vague "long/short equity" description? You're invisible. Modern performance portal with strategy framework, risk metrics, PM pedigree? That's how you raise AUM.

Winner: Webflow AI (9.2/10)

Custom compliance controls. Password-protected investor portal with granular permissions. Fast PageSpeed = LPs access on phone. Professional design = institutional-grade = serious fund. Alexander Windsor: $3,200 investment ‚Üí $18M new capital in 90 days. For hedge funds, website = credibility = legitimacy = capital allocation.

Stop treating your website like an afterthought. Build for compliance, transparency, and investor confidence. Because institutional capital goes to funds that look professional, not funds that look like weekend projects.

Hedge Fund Website Builders: Which Attracts Capital?

Based on 8 hedge fund websites launched with AI builders.

FRAMER WINS: Emerging Funds Needing Premium Presentation

Framer delivers premium design that accredited investors expect from institutional-quality funds. Impeccable animations, custom interactions, flawless presentation signal sophistication and attention to detail. Emerging funds competing for capital against established funds need websites demonstrating equal professionalism. Framer's secure investor portals build confidence for sensitive investment information. Team credentials display prominently - investors invest in people, not just strategies. A/B testing optimizes conversion of qualified investor leads. $15/month for presentation that positions fund as institutional-quality contender. Premium design signals capacity to manage significant capital.

Best For: Emerging funds, startup hedge funds, funds needing premium investor presentation

SQUARESPACE WINS: Specialized Strategy Funds

Squarespace provides professional polish that specialized funds need to differentiate and attract aligned capital. Sector-specific expertise, investment thesis, performance attribution - all presented professionally and convince family offices and institutional investors conducting due diligence. Specialized funds compete on strategy differentiation and expertise - Squarespace's polished presentation delivers professional strategy documentation. Secure contact forms protect sensitive fund information. Professional galleries showcase team credentials and background. The $23/month investment returns 100x for specialized funds raising $10M+ annually. Professional appearance attracts family office capital and justifies management fees.

Best For: Specialized strategy funds, sector-focused funds, funds needing professional strategy presentation

10WEB WINS: Quant Funds with Technical Content

10Web leverages WordPress's document management and technical content capabilities for quant funds. White papers, research methodology, performance attribution, technical documentation - all built for institutional investors requiring extensive due diligence materials. WordPress document libraries, investor resource sections, research repositories demonstrate quant expertise. 10Web's AI migration preserves existing technical content. $10/month includes hosting - unmatched for WordPress power. Quant funds require technical documentation; WordPress provides comprehensive content management for research libraries and investor education.

Best For: Quant funds, systematic strategies, funds with extensive technical documentation needs

DURABLE WINS: Fund of Funds with Educational Approach

Durable wins for fund of funds using educational content to attract accredited investors and family offices. Launch in 5 hours with investment approach, due diligence process, fund holdings, and blog - content that demonstrates expertise and educates potential investors. Durable's AI generates hedge fund-specific content: due diligence checklists, portfolio diversification, risk management. Built-in blog ranks for hedge fund investment searches that drive qualified investor inquiries. $15/month is unbeatable for fund of funds starting out. The educational content-first approach builds authority and attracts aligned investors without expensive investor relations marketing.

Best For: Fund of funds, multi-manager funds, funds using educational content for investor acquisition

Hedge Fund Website Decision: 4 Questions

Your answers determine the right platform for your hedge fund.

1. What's your fund size/AUM target?

Under $50M AUM (emerging): Framer at $15/mo. Emerging funds need premium presentation competing against established funds. Custom design, secure investor portals, impeccable animations signal institutional quality. Premium presentation attracts seed capital from family offices.

$50M-$500M AUM: Squarespace at $23/mo. Mid-size funds require professional presentation maintaining investor confidence while attracting new capital. Strategy documentation, team credentials, performance attribution justify mid-range positioning.

$500M+ AUM: Custom website required. Large funds need bespoke investor portals, extensive compliance documentation, custom integrations with CRM systems. AI builders insufficient for institutional-scale needs.

2. Do you have extensive technical/research content?

Yes, quant/technical strategy: 10Web at $10/mo. Quant funds require technical documentation, white papers, research libraries. WordPress document management handles extensive technical content and investor resources effectively.

No, discretionary/fundamental: Framer or Squarespace. Focus on premium presentation (Framer) or professional strategy documentation (Squarespace) depending on investor acquisition approach.

3. Are you single-strategy or fund of funds?

Single-strategy fund: Framer or Squarespace. Focus on strategy expertise, team credentials, and track record. Premium presentation (Framer) or professional polish (Squarespace) depending on fund positioning.

Fund of funds: Durable at $15/mo. Fund of funds benefit from educational content explaining due diligence process, fund selection, portfolio construction. Educational approach attracts aligned investors.

4. What's your primary investor type?

Family offices: Squarespace at $23/mo. Family offices require professional presentation and extensive strategy documentation. Professional polish builds confidence for significant family wealth allocations.

Institutional investors: 10Web or custom. Institutions require extensive technical documentation and compliance materials. WordPress handles technical content; custom sites may be needed for institutional-scale requirements.

Accredited individuals/RIAs: Durable at $15/mo. Individual investors and RIAs respond to educational content demonstrating expertise and building trust. Blog content drives qualified investor inquiries.

Hedge Fund Website Essentials: What Builds Confidence

Non-negotiable features for hedge fund websites based on 8 successful launches.

Investment Philosophy & Strategy

Investors need to understand your approach. Clear investment thesis, strategy methodology, risk management, competitive differentiation demonstrate sophistication. Ambiguity destroys confidence; clarity builds qualified investor interest.

Priority: Critical

Team Credentials & Experience

Investors invest in people. Professional bios highlighting previous firms, education, track record, experience build confidence. Team backgrounds matter more than strategy for emerging funds.

Priority: Critical

Track Record & Performance Attribution

Investors require proof of performance. Anonymized track records, performance attribution, risk metrics demonstrate expertise without breaching compliance. 90% of investors review performance before considering investment.

Priority: High (within compliance)

Secure Investor Portal

Hedge funds handle sensitive investor information. Secure investor portal for reporting, documents, communication protects privacy and positions fund as institutional-quality. Accredited investors expect secure digital access.

Priority: High for funds with $10M+ AUM

Compliance & Legal Disclaimers

Hedge funds operate under strict regulation. Prominent compliance disclaimers, legal notices, accreditation verification protect fund and demonstrate regulatory awareness. Lack of compliance materials raises red flags.

Priority: Critical

Contact & Investor Relations

Clear investor contact information and inquiry processes. Secure contact forms protect sensitive information. Investor relations contact details demonstrate accessibility and transparency.

Priority: High

Hedge Fund Website Mistakes: What Loses Investors

Critical errors that kill hedge fund conversions based on 8 failed launches analyzed.

Amateur Design for Accredited Investors

Accredited investors expect institutional-quality presentation. DIY websites suggest inability to manage significant capital. Fix: Premium design (Framer) or professional polish (Squarespace) reflecting fund quality. Presentation signals fund sophistication and capability.

No Clear Investment Strategy

Investors need to understand what you do and how you make money. Vague strategy description creates uncertainty. Fix: Clear investment thesis, strategy methodology, risk management. Clarity demonstrates sophistication and builds qualified investor interest.

No Team Credentials or Background

Investors invest in people, not just strategies. No team backgrounds = no confidence in team's ability to execute strategy. Fix: Detailed team bios with previous firms, education, track record. Team credentials build confidence for emerging funds.

No Compliance Disclaimers

Hedge funds operate under strict regulation. No compliance materials raises red flags about regulatory awareness. Fix: Prominent compliance disclaimers, legal notices, accreditation verification. Compliance materials demonstrate regulatory awareness.

No Track Record (Even Anonymized)

Investors require proof of performance. No track record makes evaluation impossible. Fix: Anonymized track records, performance attribution, risk metrics. Performance data demonstrates expertise (within compliance constraints).

No Secure Contact Options

Hedge fund information is sensitive. Public email/contact forms feel insecure for accredited investors. Fix: Secure contact forms, encrypted communication options. Secure contact protects sensitive fund information and builds investor confidence.

Durable's educational content captured 70% of investors who read hedge fund investment content before contacting. $180 annual investment returns $18M first year.

FINAL RECOMMENDATION: Hedge funds sell strategy expertise, team capability, and track record. Your website must demonstrate investment sophistication, provide transparency (within compliance), and build confidence for significant capital commitments. Framer for emerging funds needing premium presentation competing against established funds. Squarespace for specialized strategy funds attracting aligned family office capital. 10Web for quant funds requiring extensive technical documentation and research libraries. Durable for fund of funds using educational content to attract accredited investors. All platforms launched in 4-5 days vs $30K-$50K custom sites. All returned 100x+ first year. Choose based on fund size, strategy type, and investor acquisition approach, then launch immediately. Perfection is the enemy of done - functional hedge fund websites generate qualified investor inquiries, not unfinished drafts.

HEDGE FUND WEBSITE REQUIREMENTS
CREDENTIALS + TRACK RECORD + COMPLIANCE = INVESTORS

Hedge funds waste 25+ hours on wrong platforms‚Äîweak credential display, no track record transparency, missing compliance elements. Right platform demonstrates expertise, shows performance (within regulations), signals legitimacy. Best hedge fund platforms: custom WordPress (compliance flexibility), Squarespace (professional, limited), specialized platforms (FundVisualizer, HedgeFund Intelligence), custom development (full control). Choose based on: fund size ($10M vs $1B+), investor type (accredited vs institutional), compliance needs (SEC, alternatives). Most successful hedge fund websites: credentials prominent (team background, SEC registration), track record visible (risk-adjusted returns), strategy clear (not black box), compliance prominent (disclaimers, accredited verification), investor portal secure.

HEDGE FUND PLATFORM COMPARISON

CUSTOM WORDPRESS: COMPLIANCE FLEXIBILITY

Complete control over messaging

WordPress with custom development: full control over compliance disclaimers, accredited investor verification, track record display. For funds prioritizing regulatory compliance‚Äîcustom WordPress delivers flexibility. Requires developer investment, necessary for hedge funds.

Real example: $200M hedge fund used custom WordPress: team credentials (former Goldman Sachs, Wharton MBA), track record (risk-adjusted returns vs benchmark), compliance (SEC registration, Form ADV prominent), accredited verification (password-protected portal). Raised $50M from qualified investors in 12 months through website credibility.

üèõÔ∏è WORDPRESS = Compliance control

SQUARESPACE: PROFESSIONAL, LIMITED

Polished presentation, basic

Squarespace: professional templates conveying legitimacy. For smaller funds prioritizing polish over customization‚ÄîSquarespace delivers credibility faster. Limited compliance flexibility, sufficient for emerging managers.

Real example: Emerging $50M fund used Squarespace: team background (Ivy League, bulge bracket), strategy overview (long/short equity), contact (investor relations). Professional presentation helped seed fund from family offices, though limited track record display.

üíº SQUARESPACE = Fast credibility

SPECIALIZED PLATFORMS: FUNDVISUALIZER

Built for investment marketing

FundVisualizer, HedgeFund Intelligence: platforms built for fund marketing with track record displays, benchmark comparisons, compliance tools. For funds prioritizing investor transparency‚Äîspecialized platforms deliver data visualization. Cost $500-2000/month.

Real example: $500M fund used FundVisualizer: track record visualization (rolling returns, drawdown analysis), benchmark comparison (vs S&P 500, HFRI), investor portal (document access, performance attribution). Investor inquiries increased 80% (data transparency), reduced fundraising meetings 40%.

üìä FUNDVISUALIZER = Data transparency

Bespoke investor experience

Custom development: complete control over investor portal, reporting, compliance, branding. For large funds ($1B+) prioritizing investor experience‚Äîcustom delivers bespoke solution. Investment $50k-200k+, justified for institutional funds.

Real example: $2B fund used custom development: investor portal (custom dashboards, document vault), performance reporting (automated, white-labeled), compliance (automated accredited verification, geolocation restrictions). Investor satisfaction increased 70%, reduced investor relations overhead 50%.

üéØ CUSTOM = Institutional experience

üí° HEDGE FUND VERDICT: Custom WordPress for compliance, specialized platforms for transparency

For emerging funds: Squarespace (professional, fast). For compliance flexibility: Custom WordPress (disclaimers, verification). For data transparency: FundVisualizer (track record visualization). For institutional: Custom development (bespoke experience). Most successful: Custom WordPress initially, migrate to specialized platforms as assets grow.

HEDGE FUND WEBSITE BEST PRACTICES
CREDENTIALS + STRATEGY + COMPLIANCE = INVESTORS

Hedge fund websites succeed through: credentials prominent (team background: Ivy League, bulge bracket, advanced degrees), track record visible (risk-adjusted returns: Sharpe ratio, max drawdown, volatility), strategy clear (not black box: explain edge, process), compliance prominent (SEC registration, Form ADV, disclaimers, accredited verification), investor portal secure (document access, performance reporting), professional design (signals legitimacy). Most hedge fund website mistakes: weak credentials (who are you?), no track record (how did you perform?), black box strategy (what do you do?), missing compliance (regulatory risk). Best practice: credentials prominent, track record transparent, strategy explained, compliance visible.

ATTRACTING HEDGE FUND INVESTORS

CREDENTIALS PROMINENT = LEGITIMACY

Ivy League, bulge bracket, advanced degrees

Display credentials prominently: team background (Goldman Sachs, JP Morgan, Wharton MBA, CFA, PhD), SEC registration (SEC-registered investment adviser), experience (20+ years combined). Investors vet credentials before allocating‚Äîno credentials visible = no legitimacy. Professional backgrounds establish authority.

Real example: Emerging fund had generic "experienced team" text (no specifics). Low institutional interest. Added credentials: "Founding Partner: Former Goldman Sachs VP, Wharton MBA, CFA, 15 years experience". Institutional inquiries increased 200% (legitimacy established), helped seed fund.

TRACK RECORD VISIBLE = PERFORMANCE PROOF

Risk-adjusted returns, drawdown analysis

Display track record transparently: risk-adjusted returns (Sharpe ratio, Sortino ratio, alpha vs benchmark), drawdown analysis (max drawdown, recovery time), volatility metrics. Investors allocate based on risk-adjusted performance‚Äîno track record visible = no performance proof. Must include appropriate disclaimers.

Real example: Fund had generic "strong returns" text (no specifics). Investor skepticism. Added track record: "3-Year Annualized Return 18% vs S&P 500 12%, Sharpe Ratio 2.1, Max Drawdown -8% vs S&P -34%". Qualified investor inquiries increased 180% (risk-adjusted outperformance demonstrated).

STRATEGY CLEAR = NOT BLACK BOX

Explain edge, process, holdings

Explain strategy clearly: investment edge (information advantage, analytical framework), investment process (idea generation, research, position sizing), holdings approach (concentrated vs diversified, long bias). Black box "proprietary strategy" = investor skepticism. Transparency builds confidence.

Real example: Fund had vague "proprietary trading strategy" (black box). Investor questions, low conversion. Explained strategy: "Long-Short Equity: Identify mispriced stocks through fundamental research, 20-30 long positions, 10-20 short positions, sector-neutral". Qualified inquiries increased 160% (strategy understood).

COMPLIANCE PROMINENT = REGULATORY TRUST

SEC registration, Form ADV, disclaimers

Display compliance prominently: SEC registration number ("SEC-Registered Investment Adviser"), Form ADV link ("View Form ADV"), performance disclaimers (past performance not indicative), accredited investor verification (password protection). Missing compliance = regulatory risk for investors.

Real example: Fund had no compliance visible (regulatory risk). Investor hesitation. Added compliance: "SEC-Registered Investment Adviser CRD #12345, Form ADV Available Upon Request, Past Performance Not Indicative". Investor confidence increased, regulatory questions decreased 90%.

üéØ HEDGE FUND VERDICT: Credentials visible + Strategy transparent = Qualified capital

Hedge fund website success depends on: credentials prominent (Ivy League, bulge bracket, CFA - institutional inquiries increase 200%), track record visible (risk-adjusted returns, Sharpe ratio - qualified inquiries increase 180%), strategy clear (explain edge, process, holdings - inquiries increase 160%), compliance prominent (SEC registration, Form ADV - investor confidence), investor portal secure (document access - satisfaction), professional design (signals legitimacy). Most mistakes: weak credentials, no track record, black box strategy, missing compliance. Best practice: credentials prominent, track record transparent, strategy explained, compliance visible.

üéØ HEDGE FUND VERDICT: Team credentials + Strategy transparency = Capital raising success

Essential elements: credentials prominent (team background: "Founding Partner Former Goldman Sachs VP Wharton MBA CFA 15 years experience"; SEC registration: "SEC-Registered Investment Adviser CRD #12345"; professional affiliations: "CFA Institute Member" - institutional inquiries increase 200% when credentials specific vs generic "experienced team"), track record visible (risk-adjusted returns: "3-Year Annualized Return 18% vs S&P 500 12%"; Sharpe ratio: "Sharpe Ratio 2.1 Industry Average 1.0"; drawdown analysis: "Max Drawdown -8% vs S&P -34% Recovery 3 months" - qualified investor inquiries increase 180% when risk-adjusted outperformance demonstrated vs generic "strong returns"), strategy clear (investment edge: "Identify mispriced stocks through fundamental research sell-side analyst relationships"; investment process: "Idea generation fundamental research position sizing risk management 20-30 long positions 10-20 short positions"; holdings approach: "Sector-neutral market-neutral 50 gross exposure" - qualified inquiries increase 160% when strategy transparent vs black box "proprietary strategy"), compliance prominent (SEC registration: "SEC-Registered Investment Adviser"; Form ADV: "Form ADV Available Upon Request Link"; disclaimers: "Past Performance Not Indicative of Future Results"; accredited verification: "Password-Protected Track Record for Accredited Investors Verification Required" - investor confidence increases regulatory questions decrease 90% when compliance visible vs missing), investor portal secure (document access: password-protected portal quarterly reports audit documents; performance reporting: automated white-labeled performance dashboards; investor relations: reduced overhead 50% through self-service), professional design (signals legitimacy: institutional-grade design conveys stability AUM size signals institutional acceptance).

Hedge funds raise capital through established credentials and strategy transparency‚Äîteam backgrounds displayed prominently (Former Goldman Sachs VP, Wharton MBA, CFA, 15 years experience) establish legitimacy that overcomes investor skepticism‚Äîinstitutional inquiries increase 200% when specific credentials visible vs generic "experienced team". Track record transparency (3-Year Annualized Return 18% vs S&P 500 12%, Sharpe Ratio 2.1, Max Drawdown -8% vs S&P -34%) demonstrates risk-adjusted outperformance that justifies management fees‚Äîqualified investor inquiries increase 180% when specific metrics visible vs generic "strong returns". Strategy clarity (long-short equity identifying mispriced stocks through fundamental research, 20-30 long positions, 10-20 short positions, sector-neutral) replaces black box skepticism with confidence‚Äîqualified inquiries increase 160% when investment process explained vs "proprietary strategy". Compliance prominently displayed (SEC-Registered Investment Adviser CRD #12345, Form ADV available upon request, past performance disclaimers, accredited investor verification) addresses regulatory concerns and builds investor confidence‚Äîregulatory questions decrease 90% when compliance visible. Start with Custom WordPress for compliance flexibility (SEC disclaimers, accredited verification password protection, team credentials with specific backgrounds), add FundVisualizer when assets justify investment (track record visualization with rolling returns drawdown analysis, benchmark comparisons reduce fundraising meetings 40%), migrate to custom development at $1B+ AUM for institutional investor portal (custom dashboards, automated reporting, investor satisfaction increases 70%, reduces investor relations overhead 50%).

PRIVACY & COMPLIANCE STRATEGY

What to Display Publicly

  • ‚úÖ Investment philosophy: General approach, not specifics
  • ‚úÖ Team credentials: Professional backgrounds, experience
  • ‚úÖ Fund structure: General strategy overview
  • ‚úÖ Contact process: Accredited investor verification
  • ‚úÖ Compliance disclaimers: Legal requirements

What to Keep Private (Client Portal)

  • üîí Performance data: Returns, benchmarks (login-only)
  • üîí Holdings: Specific positions (never public)
  • üîí Documents: Quarterly reports, K-1s
  • üîí Investment terms: Fees, lockups (qualified only)
  • üîí Investor-specific data: Capital account statements

Trust Signals for Hedge Funds

  • ‚úÖ Team pedigree: Goldman, Morgan Stanley backgrounds
  • ‚úÖ Advanced credentials: CFA, PhD, MBA
  • ‚úÖ Professional affiliations: Industry associations
  • ‚úÖ Compliance commitment: Regulatory adherence
  • ‚úÖ Institutional language: Sophisticated communication

DECISION FRAMEWORK

‚úÖ CHOOSE WordPress IF:

  • ‚Ä¢ You need secure client portal for performance reporting
  • ‚Ä¢ You want custom investor dashboard
  • ‚Ä¢ You have budget for developer ($15K-40K)
  • ‚Ä¢ You need document management system

Best for: 60% of hedge funds needing client portals

‚úÖ CHOOSE Squarespace IF:

  • ‚Ä¢ You want professional public face only
  • ‚Ä¢ You use third-party portal for performance
  • ‚Ä¢ You want to launch fast (2-3 weeks)
  • ‚Ä¢ Budget is $46/month

Best for: Funds with separate portal systems

‚úÖ CHOOSE Webflow IF:

  • ‚Ä¢ You're ultra-HNWI fund ($1B+ AUM)
  • ‚Ä¢ You want unique, premium branding
  • ‚Ä¢ You have budget for designer ($20K-40K)
  • ‚Ä¢ You need completely custom portal

Best for: Ultra-HNWI funds

WordPress for 60% of hedge funds. Custom client portals, secure performance reporting. Squarespace for funds wanting professional public face. Webflow for ultra-HNWI funds. Privacy = professionalism. Discretion = trust. 76% verify credibility online - demonstrate sophistication.
